raw_text:
Mauresmo opens with victory in LA
 
 Amelie Mauresmo and Maria Sharapova won their opening matches at the Tour Championships in Los Angeles.
 
 France's Mauresmo routed Vera Zvonareva 6-1 6-0, while Wimbledon champion Sharapova was a 6-1 6-4 winner over fellow Russian Svetlana Kuznetsova. American Serena Williams also won, edging Russian Elena Dementieva 7-6 7-5 for her second victory of the event. The event is split into two groups of four with the top two from each advancing to the semi-finals.
 
 Mauresmo's win was her ninth in a row as she tries to overtake Lindsay Davenport for the number one spot. Mauresmo spent five weeks at number one after the US Open before injury ushered Davenport back in front. "Since then, I feel very confident on court and my game is there. I want to get the ranking back, but it's very different than before I was number one. "It was an obsession, but now I take it in a relaxed way." Mauresmo completed her first match in the season-ending championship in 54 minutes as Russia's Zvonareva struggled to return her serve and failed to achieve a single break point.
 
 "She got mad a little bit and I played some great tennis," said Mauresmo, who was runner-up to Kim Clijsters in last year's final. Zvonareva has lost both her games so far, having crashed 6-2 6-4 Kuznetsova in the Staples Centre on Wednesday. "Sometimes not everything works," she said. "It was lots of pressure. Maybe that is why I couldn't do 100%. But I was fighting." Sharapova, who lost 6-2 6-2 to Kuznetsova in Beijing in September, said: "In Beijing, she was coming off such a big winning streak [14 matches] and she was unstoppable. "This time, it was important to start off well and put some pressure on her." The tournament debutant added: "I love it here. The atmosphere is great. "To be here where the Lakers play, you just feel that excitement. I love basketball." Williams admitted she is still some way off her best form but remained positive after two wins in two days. "It's hard to go out there and get it right but I'm fighting and I'm hoping," said Williams. "What makes me happy is the effort. I had a really good effort today. "I'm trying to add new dimensions to my game."
llama3.2:1b:
Mauresmo wins her 9th consecutive match, defeating Zvonareva in LA.
Sharapova edges Kuznetsova 6-1 6-4 for second win of the event.
Williams also wins, edging Dementieva 7-6 7-5.
Zvonareva struggles with serve and net play as she fails to break her opponent's service.
Sharapova had a big winning streak in Beijing last year, but Zvonareva returns strong this time.
Mauresmo starts well, losing only one game to Williams over two days.
llama3.2:3b: Amelie Mauresmo won her opening match at the Tour Championships in Los Angeles, defeating Vera Zvonareva 6-1 6-0, while Maria Sharapova and Serena Williams also advanced with wins over Svetlana Kuznetsova and Elena Dementieva respectively.
gemma2:2b: Amelie Mauresmo won her opening match in Los Angeles, defeating Vera Zvonareva 6-1 6-0. Maria Sharapova also won her match against Svetlana Kuznetsova. Serena Williams also won, edging Elena Dementieva in a close three-setter.  The event uses two group system with the top two advancing to the semi finals.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Tour Championships in Los Angeles saw French player Amelie Mauresmo and Russian player Maria Sharapova victory over their opponents Vera Zvonareva, Elena Dementieva, and Svetlana Kuznetsova respectively. Mauresmo won 6-1 6-0 against Zvonareva, while Sharapova triumphed 6-1 6-4 over Kuznetsova in a match that lasted just five minutes. Serena Williams also advanced to semi-finals after losing to Elena Dementieva. The tour is split into two groups of four, with top two players from each group advancing.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Mauresmo beats Zvonareva, Sharapova beats Kuznetsova in Tour Championships opener at Staples Center; Mauresmo tries to return to top spot as Williams wins two straight.
qwen2.5:3b: Mauresmo defeated Vera Zvonareva 6-1 6-0 in her opening match at the Tour Championships, securing her ninth straight victory and increasing her chances of reclaiming the number one ranking. Mauresmo is now relaxed about this goal compared to when she was dominant. Sharapova beat Svetlana Kuznetsova 6-1 6-4 in their first round, while Serena Williams edged Elena Dementieva 7-6 7-5 for her second victory of the event. Both Mauresmo and Sharapova expressed that pressure contributed to Zvonareva's struggles in her matches so far. Williams praised her team spirit despite not being at her best form after two consecutive wins.

Mauresmo's win was her ninth in a row as she tries to overtake Lindsay Davenport for the number one spot. I want to get the ranking back, but it's very different than before I was number one." Mauresmo completed her first match in the season-ending championship in 54 minutes as Russia's Zvonareva struggled to return her serve and failed to achieve a single break point.

Kim Clijsters had a wonderful run at last year's final against Zvonareva, who had crashed 6-2 6-4 Kuznetsova in the Staples Centre on Wednesday. She said: "Sometimes not everything works," she added. Williams admitted she is still some way off her best form but remained positive after two wins in two days. He expressed his enthusiasm about the effort. "It's hard to go out there and get it right but I'm fighting and I'm hoping," Williams said.
